intro: Iris xiphium proles hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It features striking blue to violet flowers with a distinctive white or yellow beard on the lower petals. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that grow from a rhizomatous root system. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
